data.profileText: a Representative from Maryland; born in Carlisle, Cumberland County, Pa., in 1764; pursued classical studies; studied law; admitted to the bar in 1791 and commenced practice in Harford County, Md.; member of the Maryland state house of delegates 1793-1798; Maryland state's attorney 1793-1796; elected as a Democratic Republican to the Tenth, Eleventh, and Twelfth Congresses and served from March 4, 1807, until April 29, 1811, when he resigned, before the convening of the Twelfth Congress; moved to Baltimore, Md., in 1811; appointed attorney general of Maryland on April 29, 1811, and served until February 11, 1818; appointed captain of the Baltimore Union Artillery on March 25, 1814, and took part in the Battle of North Point; again a member of the Maryland state house of delegates in 1819; mayor of Baltimore 1820-1826; died in Baltimore, Md., July 17, 1828; interment in the cemetery of the Methodist Episcopal Church (now abandoned) at Bel Air, Harford County, Md.

researchRecord.description: A letter from Eleazar Wheelock to John Montgomery written in April 1799. In the letter, Wheelock writes to his benefactor, John Montgomery, to request a solution other than imprisonment for Wheelock's great financial troubles. Wheelock considers leaving Hanover.
